comments: This class will give you an intimate view of mercury. Elsie is a great teacher and the information is very interesting! The final project also allows you to pursue something that you are interested in a see a slice of the work that mercury scientists do!

This is a very engaging course for anyone who is interested in the social and technical aspects of mercury as an environmental pollutant. This course is different (in a good way) in the emphasis it puts on the issues of today and specific challenges of the future. There is a fair amount of technical information that you need to understand for the course, but it is all in the service of understanding broad real-life issues.
The course is a cool way to be introduced to topics ranging from mercury biogeochemistry to epidimiology and risk assessment. Elsie and Helen are great.
